delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

ArubaAaaProfile_AuthenticationLagAttribu.description: Group for authentication attributes which are supported on lag interface.

x-enumDescriptions.DEVICE_MODE:
The first authenticated client grants network access to all the other
clients.
x-enumDescriptions.CLIENT_MODE:
Each client must be authenticated separately to be granted network
access.
x-enumDescriptions.MULTI_DOMAIN:
Limit the number of authenticated clients to one 'voice' client and a
configured number of 'data' clients.

auth-mode.description:
The mode determining how each client on the interface can gain access
to the network.

allow-flood-traffic.description:
Enable transmission of flood traffic (broadcast, multicast and
unknown unicast) out authentication enabled interfaces with no
authenticated client.

client-limit.description: Maximum number of clients that can be authenticated on the interface.

lldp.description: Enable LLDP packets to trigger authentication.

cdp.description: Enable CDP packets to trigger authentication.

x-enumDescriptions.CHASSIS_MAC: Use the chassis MAC in LLDP TLV
x-enumDescriptions.SOURCE_MAC: Use the source MAC in LLDP frame

mac-type.description:
MAC address to use when authentication is triggered by an
LLDP frame. This is applicable only when LLDP packets are
allowed to trigger authentication.

bpdu-bypass.description:
BPDUs to be serviced by the device before authentication is
successful on the interface.

lldp.description:
Enable LLDP packets to be serviced by the device before
authentication is successful on the interface.

cdp.description:
Enable CDP packets to be serviced by the device before
authentication is successful on the interface.

bpdu-proxy-logoff.description:
Proxy logoff the client based on the interface status in BPDU packets.
Device will clear authentication session of the client if it receives
an interface down status in the BPDU packet.
When not configured, no action is taken.

items.description:
Precedence order for port-access authentication. Auth-precedence must
contain either 0 or 2 elements. If empty, the default precedence
order of dot1x followed by mac-auth will be used.

Priority order for port-access authentication. Auth-priority must
contain either 0 or 2 elements. If not set, priority will follow
the 'auth-precedence' order.

x-enumDescriptions.AAA: Onboard clients based on AAA authentication.

items.description:
Precedence order when onboarding a client. Onboarding-precedence must
contain either 0 or 2 elements. If empty, the default precedence order
of AAA followed by device-profile will be used.

concurrent-onboarding.description:
Enable authentication methods to start concurrently for faster
onboarding. If not set, clients are onboarded based on the order
specified by 'onboarding-precedence'.

mda-data-clients-limit.description:
Maximum number of 'data' clients that can be authenticated on the
interface when multi-domain is enabled. If the number of 'data' clients
on the interface exceeds this client limit, it will be considered as a
violation and the configured threshold-violation action is taken.

x-enumDescriptions.ENABLED:
Client can move between interfaces without authentication itself
on the new interface.
x-enumDescriptions.SECURE_ENABLED:
Client can move between interfaces but only after authenticating
itself on the new interface.

x-enumDescriptions.FINAL_AUTHENTICATION_FAILURE:
The device automatically logs-off a client if it fails
authentication with all the enabled authentication methods.
The authentication failure reason should not be one of server-reject
or server-timeout server-reject or server-timeout.

items.description:
The list of reasons when a client can be automatically logged off by
the device.

critical-auth-role.description:
The role to be applied for clients, that failed authentication
due to unreachable authentication servers.
When not set, no role is applied for clients that could not
complete authentication due to RADIUS server being unreachable.

critical-voice-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
critical-voice-vlan.description: Configure critical-auth VLAN as voice VLAN.

critical-data-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
critical-data-vlan.description: Configure critical-auth VLAN as data VLAN.

critical-voice-role.description:
The role to be applied to 'voice' client that have failed
re-authentication due to servers being unreachable.
When not set, no role will be applied for voice clients when they
fail re-authentication due to server being unreachable.

reject-role.description:
The role to be applied for clients that failed authentication.
When not set, for AOS-CX devices, no role is applied for clients that fail authentication.
A default denyall role is applied on AOS-S devices.

pre-auth-role.description:
The role to be applied for clients that are yet to be authenticated.
When not set, no role is applied for clients while the
authentication is in progress for the client.

open-voice-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
open-voice-vlan.description: Configure open-auth VLAN as voice VLAN.

open-data-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
open-data-vlan.description: Configure open-auth VLAN as data VLAN.

x-enumDescriptions.NAMED_VLAN: Configure the VLAN(s) using a named-VLAN
x-enumDescriptions.VLAN_RANGES: Configure the VLAN(s) as a list of VLAN ranges

auth-role.description:
The role to be applied for clients that have been authenticated
but not received any specific role or attribute from the authentication
server.
When not set, no role is applied for clients that successfully
authenticated without a role assigned from the RADIUS server.

fallback-role.description:
The role that will be applied to clients that have not been
assigned a role via any of the onboarding methods.
When not set, no role is applied for the client.

ubt-fallback-role.description:
For any client,for which the corresponding UBT zone reachability
is failed, ubt-fallback role is applied. The client on ubt-fallback
role is automatically reverted to the previous role whenever UBT zone
status is back to reachable state.

radius-override-enable.description:
Enable RADIUS override support. When enabled, RADIUS attributes
received from the server will override corresponding attributes
configured in the role assigned to the client.

auto-vlan-enable.description:
Enable automatic creation of a VLAN for authenticated clients if the
VLAN is not already available on the device.

cached-critical-role-enable.description:
Enables caching authenticated clients and their associated
role information on the interface. Clients are assigned to their
previously authenticated role.

x-enumDescriptions.NONE: Prevent an SNMP trap from being sent.
x-enumDescriptions.NOTIFY: Send an SNMP trap and log an event on a violation.
x-enumDescriptions.SHUTDOWN:
Send an SNMP trap, log an event and shut the interface down on a
violation.

action.description:
Action to take on a security violation (notify or shutdown).
This is only supported on physical ports.

shutdown-recovery-enable.description:
Enable auto-recovery of the interface. This is only applicable when
the violation action is set to shutdown.
The interface is re-enabled after the recovery timer has expired.

recovery-timer.description:
Time in seconds after which the interface is re-enabled if it was
shutdown in response to a violation event.
This is only applicable if shutdown recovery is enabled.

ArubaAaaProfile_RadiusAccountingConfigGr.description: Group for Radius accounting related configurations

radius-station-based-acct-session.description: Station-based RADIUS accounting session for Wireless.

multiple-server-accounting.description: Send RADIUS Accounting to all servers in RADIUS accounting server group.

dpp-netaccess-server-group.description: Associate to a DPP NetAccess server group.

download-role.description: Download Role from CPPM if not defined.

username-from-dhcp-opt12.description: Username from dhcp option 12 for non-802.1x users.

l2-auth-fail-through.description: Continue with other authentication schemes even if one fails.

user-idle-timeout.x-typeDescription: User idle timeout in seconds. Value of 0 deletes the user immediately on disassoc/disconnect. Valid range is 30-15300 seconds in multiples of 30 seconds.
user-idle-timeout.description: User idle timeout value. Value of 0 deletes the user immediately on disassoc/disconnect.

rfc3576-profile.description: This leaf will get deprecated. Please use the leaf-list rfc3576-server-list to send user disconnect, CoA.

items.description:
RFC3576 server to send user disconnect, CoA.
This field should only refer the auth servers with type RADIUS and mode as AUTH_AND_COA or COA_ONLY

wired-to-wireless-roam.description: Keep user authenticated when roaming from wired side.

reauth-wired-user-vlan-change.description: Reauthenticate wired user when changing VLANs.

enforce-dhcp.description: Require IP address to be obtained using DHCP.

pan-integration.description: Require IP mapping at Palo Alto Networks firewalls.

ageout-bridge-user.description: Ageout mechanism on bridge mode wireless clients.

dl3-radius-proxy-mode.description: Distributed L3 mode for radproxy in microbranch.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
